subTitle: Ask us anything about heating, air conditioning, or ventilation. We're here to help!

faqs.question: How often should I service my HVAC system?
faqs.answer: We recommend servicing your HVAC system at least once a year, preferably before the start of the heating or cooling season. Regular maintenance helps ensure optimal performance and extend the lifespan of your equipment.

faqs.question: What size HVAC system do I need for my home?
faqs.answer: The size of your HVAC system depends on various factors, including the square footage of your home, insulation, climate, and the number of windows. A professional technician can perform a load calculation to determine the right system size for your needs.

faqs.question: Why is my air conditioning system not cooling properly?
faqs.answer: There could be several reasons, including low refrigerant levels, a clogged air filter, a malfunctioning thermostat, or dirty coils. It's best to have a professional technician inspect the system to diagnose and fix the issue.

faqs.question: How can I improve indoor air quality with my HVAC system?
faqs.answer: To improve indoor air quality, consider upgrading your air filter, installing a whole-home air purifier, and ensuring your HVAC system is clean and well-maintained. Regular maintenance helps remove dust, allergens, and other contaminants from your air.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of a programmable thermostat?
faqs.answer: A programmable thermostat allows you to set different temperatures for various times of the day, helping to reduce energy consumption and lower utility bills. It can automatically adjust heating or cooling when you're away from home, ensuring comfort and efficiency.

faqs.question: Is it worth replacing my old HVAC system?
faqs.answer: If your system is over 10 years old and requires frequent repairs, it may be time to consider a replacement. Newer HVAC systems are more energy-efficient, offering improved performance and long-term savings on energy costs.
